constructor.details: Grants the governor address the DEFAULT_ADMIN_ROLE, GOVERNOR_ROLE, and GUARDIAN_ROLE

generateRole(uint8,address).details: Generates a unique role identifier based on the role name and target contract address

params.roleName: The name of the role (from ContractSpecificRoles enum)
params.roleTargetContract: The address of the contract the role is for

getRoleAdmin(bytes32).details: Returns the admin role that controls `role`. See {grantRole} and {revokeRole}. To change a role's admin, use {_setRoleAdmin}.

params.account: Address to grant the Commander role to
The account to which the role will be granted
params.roleName: The name of the role to grant
params.roleTargetContract: The address of the contract to grant the role for

params.account: The account to which the role will be granted
params.fleetCommanderAddress: The address of the fleet commander to grant the role for

params.account: The account to which the Governor role will be granted
The account to which the Guardian role will be granted
The account to which the role will be granted
params.fleetCommanderAddress: The address of the fleet commander to grant the role for

grantRole(bytes32,address).details: Overrides the grantRole function from AccessControl to disable direct role granting.

params.account: The account to which the Super Keeper role will be granted

renounceRole(bytes32,address).details: Revokes `role` from the calling account. Roles are often managed via {grantRole} and {revokeRole}: this function's purpose is to provide a mechanism for accounts to lose their privileges if they are compromised (such as when a trusted device is misplaced). If the calling account had been revoked `role`, emits a {RoleRevoked} event. Requirements: - the caller must be `callerConfirmation`. May emit a {RoleRevoked} event.

params.account: Address to revoke the Commander role from
The account from which the role will be revoked
params.roleName: The name of the role to revoke
params.roleTargetContract: The address of the contract to revoke the role for

params.account: The account from which the role will be revoked
params.fleetCommanderAddress: The address of the fleet commander to revoke the role for

params.account: The account from which the Governor role will be revoked
The account from which the Guardian role will be revoked
The account from which the role will be revoked
params.fleetCommanderAddress: The address of the fleet commander to revoke the role for

revokeRole(bytes32,address).details: Overrides the revokeRole function from AccessControl to disable direct role revoking.

params.account: The account from which the Super Keeper role will be revoked

params.roleName: The name of the role to revoke
params.roleTargetContract: The address of the contract to revoke the role for

supportsInterface(bytes4).details: Overrides the supportsInterface function from AccessControl

params.interfaceId: The interface identifier, as specified in ERC-165

returns._0: bool True if the contract supports the interface, false otherwise This function supports: - IProtocolAccessManager interface - All interfaces supported by the parent AccessControl contract

grantCommanderRole(address,address).notice: Grants the Commander role for a specific Ark

grantContractSpecificRole(uint8,address,.notice: Grants a contract specific role to a given account

grantCuratorRole(address,address).notice: Grants the Curator role to a given account

grantGovernorRole(address).notice: Grants the Governor role to a given account

grantGuardianRole(address).notice: Grants the Guardian role to a given account

grantKeeperRole(address,address).notice: Grants the Keeper role to a given account

grantRole(bytes32,address).notice: This function always reverts with a DirectGrantIsDisabled error.

grantSuperKeeperRole(address).notice: Grants the Super Keeper role to a given account

revokeCommanderRole(address,address).notice: Revokes the Commander role for a specific Ark

revokeContractSpecificRole(uint8,address.notice: Revokes a contract specific role from a given account

revokeCuratorRole(address,address).notice: Revokes the Curator role from a given account

revokeGovernorRole(address).notice: Revokes the Governor role from a given account

revokeGuardianRole(address).notice: Revokes the Guardian role from a given account

revokeKeeperRole(address,address).notice: Revokes the Keeper role from a given account

revokeRole(bytes32,address).notice: This function always reverts with a DirectRevokeIsDisabled error.

revokeSuperKeeperRole(address).notice: Revokes the Super Keeper role from a given account

selfRevokeContractSpecificRole(uint8,add.notice: Revokes a contract specific role from the caller

supportsInterface(bytes4).notice: Checks if the contract supports a given interface
